DataElement.preferredName: Multiphasic Magnetic Resonance Imaging Enhancement Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term representing the kind of enhancement used in the multiphase magnetic resonance imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Magnetic resonance imaging that captures lesion enhancement data during combinations of non-contrast or pre-contrast, arterial, venous, and delayed imaging sequential time ranges._To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Magnetic resonance imaging that captures lesion enhancement data during combinations of non-contrast or pre-contrast, arterial, venous, and delayed imaging sequential time ranges.

Concepts.definition: Magnetic resonance imaging that captures lesion enhancement data during combinations of non-contrast or pre-contrast, arterial, venous, and delayed imaging sequential time ranges.

Property.preferredDefinition: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0570307 - FW: Dr. Abdul Sater protocol 21C0007 BEST Trial - C3D Draft Specification Document request 4/5/2021 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A technique that uses radiofrequency waves and a magnet to image the body.  The images are enhanced by the addition of contrast agents which selectively intensify anatomical regions to intensify the clarity of the image for diagnostic purposes. 2005

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
